title: I think we're getting a new Yordle champion soon.
body:
https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-30431Jp2GN0/VvGim5W_C6I/AAAAAAAA5EQ/MQekxRxKY2wPgUoSA1-jeUJfaa6MIrilQ/s1600/Sion_Splash_5.jpg

Look closely near Sion's left leg.  Someone with big ears and a zipline.  I know this isn't canon, but this could be a sneak preview of a new champion.  Have we ever gotten a preview of a new champ by seeing their alternate reality self first?

Edit:  All right guys, it's clear I got too excited and jumped the gun on possible reveals.  Ever since {{champion:78}}'s lore update, I've bee dying to see some lore updates on the Yordles.  And the best lore updates we've had were champion updates/releases.

There was also the unknown flying Battlecast creation which/who was seen in [Creator Viktor's recall panels](http://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/leagueoflegends/images/b/b1/Viktor_Recall.png/revision/latest?cb), in the back of [the Battlecast Vel'Koz splash](http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/leagueoflegends/images/0/05/Vel%27Koz_BattlecastSkin.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20140214194213) (Behind Creator Viktor) and possibly in the [blueprints-of-a-background](https://i.gyazo.com/742a63f05d267797e31c11137dd4e030.png) of the Battlecast Alpha Skarner and Battlecast Kog'Maw [promotional site](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/skin-release/battlecast-skins), but this guy/gal never got released. :P

That was Battlecast Anivia. It was canceled for some reason or another. Riot was asked about it again 2 or 3 months ago and the rioter responding didn't seem very enthusiastic about it.

Also blackfrost came out several months before creator viktor and bc vel'koz,so why would it be featured in their skins somehow when its been cancelled already for such a long time?

ANI could easily denote Annie. ANV has only one possible interpretation if it were a reference to a champion.

Honestly though I don't think Battlecast Anivia would've been a skin at all, much less a legendary. That line already has two legendaries and the whole point of a legendary skin is to put a new concept on a champion in addition to all the new particles, model changes, VO, animations, etc.  Battlecast just wasn't new anymore and couldn't justify a third legendary in the line.

But Annie would have been ANN.

And overall it would have been a kinda awkward decision to make a bc-anivia skin considering that she has already a robotic skin with hextech anivia.

If you look at the teaser where it includes ANV, there are also abbreviations for Skarner (SKA), Kog'Maw (MAW), Xerath (XER), and Urgot (URG). If the four known abbreviations all refer to champions, it makes sense for the last one to refer to a champion as well. Anivia is the only champion that ANV could reasonably refer to. It's not that big of a stretch to think they were hinting at a skin that was in concept.
The ANV was just clearly another NEW champion that hasn't come yet.
